name: reinsertion
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of putting something back into or inside something else: If the tube does happen to come out, reinsertion can be difficult. The ambassador made a strong case for the country's reinsertion into the global community. Certain key words had been removed from the passage for re-insertion by the students. Sometimes it takes several reinsertions of a disk for the lock status to change to unlocked. Related word
insertion
More examplesFewer examplesRemoval and reinsertion of the device brings a risk that the patient may become infected.The catheter became dislodged after the operation, but reinsertion was not required.
